t: Proverbs 22
A*p good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
The*p rich and poor meet together: the Lord*s is the maker of them all.
A*p prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
By*p humility and the fear of the Lord*s are riches, and honour, and life.
Thorns*p and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
Train*p up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
The*p rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
He*p that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
He*p that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
Cast*p out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
He*p that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
The*p eyes of the Lord*s preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
The*p slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
The*p mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the Lord*s shall fall therein.
Foolishness*p is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
He*p that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
Bow*p down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
For*p it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
That*p thy trust may be in the Lord,*s I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
Have*p not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
That*p I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
Rob*p not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
For*p the Lord*s will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
Make*p no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
Lest*p thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
Be*p not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
If*p thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
Remove*p not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
Seest*p thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
